alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Newport; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Washington; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 25 at 3:13AM EST until January 28 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of Rhode Island except Block Island. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding is NOT expected to be as significant as what occurred earlier this month. However, the Pawtuxet River could come close to its moderate flood stage late Thursday night or Friday morning. Flooding 1 to 2 feet deep could affect low lying areas of Cranston and Warwick. Minor flooding less than one foot deep could also affect low lying areas along the Wood River. Flooding of streets and urban areas is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: If you live in an area prone to flooding, plan ahead. Ensure sump pumps are working or take action to protect your property. Make sure vehicles are moved out of areas that could flood. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings.
